issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Hiveserver2 in HTTP mode is not applying auth_to_local rules

comments.body:
The patch is uploaded and I am going to wait for the test results. 

Thanks
-Rahman

+1. 

KerberosName#getShortName seems to apply the translation rules (http://grepcode.com/file/repo1.maven.org/maven2/org.apache.hadoop/hadoop-auth/2.5.0/org/apache/hadoop/security/authentication/util/KerberosName.java#383).
[~sushanth] This is a bug in HS2 which affects certain secure setups. Ok for 1.2.1 (it's a small fix)? I'll add it to the wiki once you approve.

{color:red}Overall{color}: -1 no tests executed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12733626/HIVE-10528.1.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12735490 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

The build has some failures related to the following:
{code}
2015-05-27 04:38:59,538 ERROR PTest.run:180 Test run exited with an unexpected error org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.TestsFailedException: 55 tests failed
	at org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.PTest.run(PTest.java:177)
	at org.apache.hive.ptest.api.server.TestExecutor.run(TestExecutor.java:120
{code}

I am not sure if this is related to the code change in the patch. [~vgumashta] can you please confirm for me?  I am able to get a successful local build and ran through the test cases without issues. I am attaching file called 'REPRO-10528.txt' with the testing outcome. The patch did fix the issue and its using auth to local. 

Thanks
-Rahman
Patch committed to 1.2.1 and master. Thanks [~ashettia] for the contribution.
